name: Iron
description: Most iron meteorites are thought to be the cores of asteroids that melted early in their history. They consist mainly of iron-nickel metal with small amounts of sulphide and carbide minerals.

name: Stony-Iron
description: Stony-iron meteorites consist of almost equal parts iron-nickel metal and silicate minerals including precious and semi-precious gemstones. They are considered some of the most beautiful meteorites..

name: Stony-Iron
description: Mesosiderite meteorites are rocks composed of broken fragments of minerals or rock cemented together by a finer material. They contain a mix of igneous (solidified) silicate and metal clasts (rocks made of pieces of older rocks).

name: Stony
description: At over 4.5 billion years old, chondrites are some of the most primitive and pristine rocks in the solar system and have never been melted.

name: Stony
description: Achondrites include meteorites from asteroids, Mars and the Moon. They are igneous. When magma cools and crystallises, it creates a concentric layered structure. This process is known as igneous differentiation.
